title: Day 808
content:
# Day 808

It's astonishing how many corporations dominate the majority of what we buy and consume. Although these charts are somewhat outdated, the aftermath of COVID-19 likely exacerbated these issues.

> [**Data Visualization: 10 Corporations Control Almost Everything You Buy**](https://datavizblog.com/2013/11/07/data-visualization-10-corporations-control-almost-everything-you-buy/)

![[https://datavizblog.com/2013/11/07/data-visualization-10-corporations-control-almost-everything-you-buy/](https://datavizblog.com/2013/11/07/data-visualization-10-corporations-control-almost-everything-you-buy/)](https://miro.medium.com/0*5elziIwN4cXphGT3)

![[https://datavizblog.com/2013/11/07/data-visualization-10-corporations-control-almost-everything-you-buy/](https://datavizblog.com/2013/11/07/data-visualization-10-corporations-control-almost-everything-you-buy/)](https://miro.medium.com/0*HxeFqGDfZrtDt0qX)

![[https://datavizblog.com/2013/11/07/data-visualization-10-corporations-control-almost-everything-you-buy/](https://datavizblog.com/2013/11/07/data-visualization-10-corporations-control-almost-everything-you-buy/)](https://miro.medium.com/0*YVrK2TMzdjX9U7Ez)

Whenever possible, shop local. Let your money support those you interact with daily. Otherwise, you're fueling a system designed to keep us poor, sick, and unhealthy.

It's easier said than done, but every small step counts. This is how we win. By decentralizing, we can break free from those who prioritize profit over our well-being.

6/7/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
